item.title: SDS and Mental Health
item.description:
SDS and Mental Health: Key Learning Points

  • The prospect of change can be very difficult for people with mental health problems. The self-directed support options are best introduced to this group starting with option 3. Pick ‘n’ Mix
  • Bespoke assessment questionnaires are required for people with mental health problems and other fluctuating conditions to assess for when people are well and unwell. Mental Health Self Assessment Questionnaire
  • People with mental health problems should be supported to plan in advance for how they will manage their self-directed support when their condition fluctuates and they become unwell. This is best done as an extension to assessment and support planning. SDS add-on to Support Plan
  • Continuing to block fund crisis support services and develop Option 2 (known as Individual Service Fund) for people in recovery is an effective way of delivering self-directed support for people with mental health problems. Guidance for developing individual service funds for people with fluctuating conditions
  • SDS learning and development is most effective when practitioners and people who access support learn together. People with mental health problems can be very effective co-trainers. Content and methods to deliver SDS learning and development

item.title: Accessible Information Guide to Individual Service Fund (two way contract)
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The Accessible Information Guide to Individual Service Fund is for anyone seeking to understand or support understanding of SDS option 2.
What does it do? 

The Accessible Information Guide to Individual Service Fund explains how SDS option 2 works using short, easy read sentences and associated visuals.

How can you use it? 
The Accessible Information Guide to Individual Service Fund is designed for use as a supplement to your verbal explanation of SDS option 2. You can record any questions the person asks and the answers you give in the space at the end of the guide. You can then leave the Guide with the person for reference.

item.title: Guidance for developing individual service funds for people with fluctuating conditions
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The guidance for developing individual service funds for people with fluctuating conditions is for local authority SDS commissioners and providers.
What does it do? 

The guidance for developing individual service funds for people with fluctuating conditions is a design brief.

How can you use it? 
The guidance for developing individual service funds for people with fluctuating conditions sets out how local authority SDS commissioners and providers can develop option 2 for this group of people.

item.title: Maximising Outcomes Learning Materials
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The Maximising Outcomes Learning Materials are for drugs and alcohol practitioners and peer workers
What does it do? 

The Maximising Outcomes Learning Materials explore two support scenarios for the fictional character of Denise who is in recovery from substance misuse. One scenario asks groups to design support to meet Denise’s outcomes using a weekly budget and the other scenario asks groups to design support to meet Denise’s outcomes using an annual budget. When the groups come together they should be able to reflect on the pros and cons of the two scenarios.

How can you use it? 
The Maximising Outcomes Learning Materials could be used to promote learning within teams of drugs and alcohol practitioners or individually.
